|              | Good overall assessment of the relevant discourse. I suggest acknowledging a few more relevant studies as examples to strengthen the identified gap. For instance, some studies differentiate between communication and non-communication activities or do use objective measures, but they still provide mixed findings. Cabre-Riera et al. (2019), not cited in the current manuscript, use Actigraph measures, look at different activities, but adopt a cross sectional design and does not look at the communication source (i.e., close versus non-close contacts). Lemola et al. (2015), not cited in the current manuscript, also look at different activities, but use subjective data and does not look at the communication source. Tettamant et al. (2020), not cited in the current manuscript, look at communication with a longitudinal design and objective measures, but does not look at the communication source. In this section, you may mention briefly. In the later sections (e.g., Section 2.2.), you may explain with just a few sentences. |                       |
